title: The Connectome Project
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Connectome Project.

hook.text: Mapping every connection in a human brain would fill a zettabyte of dataâ€”more than all the world's digital data.

buildup.text: The connectome is a complete map of neural connections. It would explain how brain structure creates function.

discovery.text: Scientists have mapped the full connectome of a fruit fly's brainâ€”25,000 neurons and millions of connections.

twist.text: The human brain has 86 billion neurons with trillions of connections. Mapping it fully may take decades.

climax.text: Even partial maps are revealing how diseases like autism and schizophrenia alter brain wiring patterns.

punchline.text: The ultimate map is the one inside your head.

quiz.question: What has the connectome project successfully mapped so far?
options: The complete brain of a fruit fly
The entire human brain at full resolution
